channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report X-2024030116
item.description:
Report X-2024030116

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-01
  • City: REDMOND
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO DOOR. THE RESPONDER USED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPOND SHEETS TO CLEAN THE AREA. THE RESPONDER THEN MOVE THE PACKAGE AND DEBRIS TO THE PSC TO FINNISH PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024030076
item.description:
Report X-2024030076

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-08T18:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-24
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED BY A CLERK IN SMALL SORT WHO DETECTED A STRONG ODOR EMANATING FROM THE PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP FLOOR AND GIVEN TO A RESPONDER. UPON INSPECTION THE PACKAGE DID NOT HAVE ANY PHYSICAL SIGNS OF LEAKAGE BUT DID IN FACT SMELL STRONGLY OF SOLVENT. HAZMAT LABELLING ON THE PACKAGE FURTHER INDICATED THE PRODUCT INSIDE HAD BEEN COMPROMISED AND NEEDED TO BE CONTAINED IMMEDIATELY. PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND THE PRODUCT WAS CLEARLY HEAVILY SOILED FROM INTERNAL LEAKAGE, WHICH WAS MOSTLY CONTAINED VIA PLASTIC WRAPPING OVER PRODUCT, HOWEVER VAPOR WAS ESCAPING. PRODUCT WAS IMMEDIATELY BAGGED WITH LIQUIDS PRESENT TO PREVENT FURTHER VAPOR RELEASE.

item.title: Report X-2024021791
item.description:
Report X-2024021791

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: BURLINGTON
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found wet as it left trailer. Then brought to repack to be inspected and repacked. When inspected at repack item was found to be leaking from cap. When SDS was looked up item was discovered to be regulated. Outer box was unmarked. DescribePack: Cap on crooked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Was put in a plastic tote with plastic bag to prevent leaking on other boxes.

item.title: Report X-2024021611
item.description:
Report X-2024021611

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: TUKWILA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: LEAKING STEEL DRUM WAS DISCOVERED BY AN AUDITOR WHO THEN NOTIFIED A RESPONDER. ALL PPE (GLOVES, GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON, SILVER LINING) WAS PUT ON AND DRUM WAS PLACED INTO A YELLOW TUB/DMP BAG. DRUM WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. ALL PPE/TUBS WERE THEN DECONTAMINATED AND DRUM WAS FURTHER PROCESSED INTO ETT.
